label: 被官
本: The Making of a Japanese Periphery, 1750-1920 . University of California Press . 1995
説明文: Hikan was the most prevalent term used in Shimoina to denote the hereditary servile class, who were numerous among the early Tokugawa peasantry. (p.110); Alternate terms for this group include nago, kobun, kadonomono, and kadoya. (Footnote: p.110) [名子、子分、門の者、門屋]
